Source¶

FHash is a GUI enabled python script to compute hash files in a directory and verify the hashes generated to check if files were changed/altered. List of hashes created is stored in a text file with current timestamp as filename.

Format of hash stored is as follows:

ABSOLUTE_PATH_TO_FILE|DIGEST_ALGORITHM|HASH

Note

  • ‘|’ is used as a delimitter.
  • Hash algorithm used must be supported by Hashlib.
FHash.choose_file(btn)¶

Action function for file interaction buttons.

Parameters:btn – identifier of button being pressed
FHash.hash_file(filename, digest)¶

Hash file

Parameters:
  • source – source directory in which all files are to be hashed
  • digest – digest algorithm to use
FHash.iter_hash(source, digest_algorithm)¶

Iterate through all files in source list and hash.

Parameters:
  • source – source directory in which all files are to be hashed
  • digest_algorithm – digest algorithm to use
FHash.iter_verify(destination)¶

Iterate through all files in hash list and verify.

Parameters:destination – file with target filenames, digest algorithm and hash
FHash.main()¶

Main function for FCopy.

FHash.press(btn)¶

Function called by pressing the action buttons in GUI.

Parameters:btn – identifier of button being pressed
FHash.sanity_check_destination(d)¶

Sanity check if hash file exists.

Parameters:d – hash file to to check for existance
Returns:0 if error else 1 if no error
Return type:int
FHash.sanity_check_source(s)¶

Sanity check if directory or file exists.

Parameters:s – source directory/file to to check for existance
Returns:0 if error else 1 if no error
Return type:int
FHash.write_file(result)¶

Write result to file that user will choose.

Parameters:result – result to be written
